page.title: 05TRANSPORT-WOODHOUSE STATION
page.content: The station in Woodhouse was built in the 1880's. It has two platforms for trains which go to Sheffield, Retford, Lincoln and Cleethorpes. It is used by one hundred people each day and trains pass through it every forty minutes. The station has two bridges made of concrete which go over the tracks. There are four railway tracks in use and one that is rusted over. The railway tracks are made of metal with wooden and concrete sleepers. The first track was called the Old Road and it was the main line from Hull to Liverpool. Most of the trains that pass through Woodhouse Station are passenger trains, mail trains or freight trains.
